p: The sutured wound’s breadth was documented from D 0 up to D 21 to realize the reduction of the wound. Results indicated that the sutured area’s breadth was remarkably reduced from the D 7 ( Table 2) irrespective of treatments. Wound contraction is the inward motion of cutting edges that helps close a wound, which occurs throughout 5–15 days of wounding [ 20]. Insignificant ( p > 0.05) difference was detected in terms of the weekly decline of contraction length ( Table 1) in the wounds of all groups. This result conforms with the proposition of Yannas et al. [ 21]. They stated that in the skin, the spontaneous wound healing process occurred through a contractile mechanical area to make collagen fiber meshwork. They also noted that contraction and regeneration of wounds are belligerently related to each other, where wound contraction is a dominant process during the natural healing of wounds.
